propulsion.name: Engine Flameout
propulsion.description: Sudden extinction of the flame in the combustion chamber. Can be caused by water ingestion, heavy turbulence, or fuel starvation.

propulsion.name: Engine Fire
propulsion.description: Uncontrolled combustion within the engine nacelle. Requires immediate shutoff and fire suppression.

propulsion.name: Compressor Stall
propulsion.description: Disruption of airflow through the compressor. Can lead to surging and engine damage.

propulsion.name: In-flight Thrust Reverser Deployment
propulsion.description: Extremely dangerous mechanical failure where reversers deploy while airborne.

hydraulics.name: Total Hydraulic System Loss
hydraulics.description: Complete loss of fluid in all hydraulic lines, often due to a central point of failure (e.g., engine burst).

hydraulics.name: Hydraulic Pump Failure
hydraulics.description: Failure of an engine-driven or electric hydraulic pump.

avionics.name: Pitot Tube Blockage
avionics.description: Icing or insect nest blocking the pitot tubes, leading to erroneous airspeed readings.

avionics.name: Inertial Reference System Drift
avionics.description: Slowly increasing error in position and attitude data.

structural.name: Cargo Door Explosive Decompression
structural.description: Failure of cargo door latches leading to rapid loss of cabin pressure and potential floor collapse.

structural.name: Delayed Tail Strike Failure
structural.description: Damage from a previous tail strike causing a structural failure during pressurized flight.

failure_patterns.name: Total Power Loss
failure_patterns.description: Loss of all engines due to bird strike, volcanic ash, or fuel contamination.

failure_patterns.name: Uncontained Engine Failure
failure_patterns.description: Engine parts breach the nacelle, damaging other systems.

failure_patterns.name: Sensory Data Inconsistency
failure_patterns.description: Multiple sensors failing or providing conflicting data, overwhelming the crew.
failure_patterns.strategy: Fly by pitch and power settings.
